item.title: Program Sections
item.description: Every program is split into multiple sections. In general, these are: The code segment containing executable code The stack segment Data segment, which constitute the following: BSS Uninitialized data Heap Memory allocated during run time Data Initialized data They are just the defaults, there can be many more sections in a binary. For example our sample code contains the following different sections. $ objdump -h a.out Most of the section compiled into the binary is either empty or just debugging information.
